summary: James K. Conzelman is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) based on multiple payroll and certification reports. These documents span from 1977 to 1978, indicating Conzelman's involvement with the committee during that period. The documents list Conzelman's name, position, salary, and pay period earnings. The consistency of his appearance across multiple payroll certifications and certification reports suggests a sustained role within the HSCA during its investigation.
significance: James K. Conzelman's significance lies in his employment with the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), indicating his participation in the investigation of President Kennedy's assassination. The documents suggest he was a staff member involved in the day-to-day operations of the committee, as evidenced by his presence on payroll and certification reports.
